channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for NJ
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for NJ

item.title: Report X-2024080137
item.description:

Transportation by road has been confirmed. Shipment also contains UN3481 Lithium ion batteries contained in equipment Class 9 Single Package or Inner Packaging(if any): Packaging Type: Case Material of Construction: Plastic Package Capacity: 240 g Amount in Package: 240 g Number in Shipment: 1 Number Failed: 1

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On inspecting the hazmat package, all four (4) contents possible leaked out. Only two (2) of the contents arrived at the hazmat cage with the fiberboard box. Approximately 0.25lg was leaked from the remaining two (2) gallons. They were placed in a lined salvage drum for further information on disposition.

item.title: Report X-2024071995
item.description:
Report X-2024071995

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-01T15:14:26+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-23
  • City: BARRINGTON
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: DURING THE UNLOAD THE MANAGER NOTICED THE PACKAGE WAS WET AND LEAKING. THE MANAGER IMMEDIATELY TOOK THE PACKAGE TO THE HAZMAT CAGE TO SECURE AND VENTILATE PROPERLY. I WAS THEN CALLED OVER TO REPACK INTO SALVAGE DRUMS IN A TIMELY AND SAFE MANNER. APPROXIMATELY 1 LITER LEAKED OUT DUE TO THE LIDS/CLOSURES BEING CRUSHED AND LOOSE. AWAITING DISPOSITION FROM PGH NOW.

item.title: Report X-2024071989
item.description:
Report X-2024071989

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-01T15:14:26+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-23
  • City: KEASBEY
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SHIPMENT TAKEN OUT OF THE SYSTEM FLOW, DUE TO EXTERNAL CARTON TORN, WET. UPON INSPECTION INNER CONTENTS OF THE PACKAGE WAS 4 x 4 GAL ECOLAD AQUA BALANCE MURIATIC ACID IN PLASTIC BOTTLES. EACH BOTTLE HAD A LOOSE CAP WHICH CAUSED SPILLAGE. THE OUTER PACKAGING WAS DAMAGED. FACILITY PROCEDURES FOR DAMAGED HAZARDOUS MATERIAL FOLLOWED, CONTENTS CONTAINED AND AWAITING DISPOSITION

item.title: Report X-2024072039
item.description:
Report X-2024072039

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-31T21:13:28+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-24
  • City: KEASBEY
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SHIPMENT WAS BROUGHT BACK TO TERMINAL WITH NO EXPLANATION WAS PROVIDED FROM DRIVER UPON HIS RETURN TO THE TERMINAL. UPON INSPECTION OF INNER CONTENTS DURING THE TWILIGHT SHIFT 4X4L (GLASS BOTTLES) SIGMA-ALDRICH ACETONITRILE WITH ONE BOTTLE BEING CRACKED AND BROKEN WHICH CAUSED LEAKAGING ALLOWING 100% SPILLAGE. WHICH ALSO CAUSED DAMAGE TO THE OUTER PACKAGING AS WELL. FACILITY PROCEDURES FOR DAMAGED HAZARDOUS MATERIAL FOLLOWED, CONTENTS CONTAINED AND AWAITING DISPOSITION.

item.title: Report X-2024071657
item.description:
Report X-2024071657

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-31T21:13:28+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-16
  • City: BARRINGTON
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: DURING THE UNLOAD THE MANAGER NOTICED THE PACKAGE WAS WET AND THAT THE CLOSURES WERE RIPPED OPEN AS WELL. THE MANAGER IMMEDIATELY TOOK THE PACKAGE TO THE HAZMAT CAGE TO SECURE AND VENTILATE IT PROPERLY. I WAS THEN CALLED OVER TO REPACK IT INTO A YELLOW SALVAGE DRUM IN SAFE AND TIMELY MANNER. APPROXIMATELY 10 LITERS LEAKED OUT DUE TO ALL 4 CAPS BEING LOOSE AND ALSO 2 CAPS HAD A TINY HOLES IN EACH OF THEM. AWAITING THE DISPOSITION NOW FROM PGH.

item.title: Report I-2024070085
item.description:
Report I-2024070085

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-31T18:16:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-09
  • City: Saddle Brook
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 1025
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: At approximately 22 : 11 a package containing an undelcared 6000Wh lithium ion battery, with terminals unprotected, was placed on the metal grating outside of door 102. Moments later, the package started emitting smoke and plant engineering was notified. The package caught on fire and employees evacuated the building as the fire department was called. A mechanic and his supervisor attempted to extinguish the fire but it kept reigniting. The fire department arrived, pulled the package outside, and extinguished it. At 22:58. the fire department gave the 'all cleaT to return to the building.
